intro: Parmentiera balduinii, commonly known as the Mexican devil's backbone, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and its leaves are usually opposite and ovate. Parmentiera balduinii is characterized by its woody stems and can reach heights of up to 5 meters. It is often found in limestone soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
